abstract.text: The
class displays the contents of the selected camera.

abstract.text: Allow users to browse, edit, and save images, using slideshows and Core Image filters.
The
class displays the contents of the selected camera.
The current camera device.
Returns whether the selected items can be deleted.
Returns whether the selected items can be downloaded
Returns whether the selected items can be rotated left.
Returns whether the selected items can be rotated right.
The camera device view delegate.
Deletes the currently selected items.
Specifies whether the downloads directory control should be displayed.
Displays whether the post process application control should be displayed.
Allows the “Download All” control to be renamed.
Downloads all the items.
Allows the “Download Selected” control to be renamed.
Deletes the selected items from the camera.
Specifies the directory where files are downloaded
Returns whether the device view is being displayed in icon mode.
Returns whether the device view is being displayed in table mode.
Specifies the icon size.
Specifies the display mode of the camera device view.
The URL of the application used to post process the image.
Rotates the selected image to the left.
Rotates the selected image to the right.
Invoked to select the specified files, extending the selection if specified.
The selected indexes of the camera files.
Determines how the contents are saved by the delegate.
These constants specify the display mode used by the camera view. These constants are used by
These constants specify the transfer mode used by the camera view. These constants are used by
The
allows you to select a camera or scanner from a list of the available devices.
Presents a user interface for browsing filters.
The
class is used as a container for the elements of an
object.
Input parameters for filtering core image filters.
A class used to display a cell.
The
class provides a panel, that is, a utility window that floats on top of document windows, optimized for image editing.
A view that allows displaying and minor editing of an image.
The

class represents a panel that allows users to choose images by browsing the file system. The picture taker panel provides an Open Recent menu, supports image cropping, and supports taking snapshots from an iSight or other digital camera.
The
class initializes, adds, and manages user interface options for saving image data.
The
class displays a view that allows scanning. It can be customized by specifying the display mode. The delegate receives the scanned data and must implement the
protocol.
The
protocol defines the delegate protocol that the
delegate must conform to.
The
class encapsulates a data source and options for a slideshow.
The infrastructure for drawing, printing, and handling events in an app.
The complete list of properties and methods for accessible elements.
A role-based protocol that declares the minimum interface necessary to interact with an assistive app.
A set of methods that defines a way to add animation to an existing class with a minimum of API impact.
A set of methods for getting and setting the appearance attributes of a view.
A protocol that enables an object to be encoded and decoded for archiving and distribution.
A set of methods that the destination object (or recipient) of a dragged image must implement.
The group of methods that are fundamental to all Objective-C objects.
Methods that responder subclasses implement to support key binding commands, such as inserting tabs and newlines, or moving the insertion point.
A protocol that an object adopts to create a bar object in your app.
A protocol that marks classes to restore the state of your app to continue a user activity.
A set of methods used to associate a unique identifier with objects in your user interface.
A type that can be hashed into a `Hasher` to produce an integer hash value.
A type that can be compared for value equality.
A singleton actor whose executor is equivalent to the main dispatch queue.
A type with a customized textual representation.
A type with a customized textual representation suitable for debugging purposes.
A type whose instances can be encoded, and appropriately passed, as elements of a C `va_list`.
